citation.article-title: Dialister invisus sp. nov., isolated from the human oral cavity.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of Dialister pneumosintes (Olitsky and Gates 1921) Moore and Moore 1994
The description is as described by Moore & Moore (1994), with the following additions: aesculin and urea are not hydrolysed; indole and catalase are not produced.
There is no growth in 20 % bile.
The Rapid ID 32A profile is 0000 0100 00, which corresponds to a positive reaction for arginine arylamidase.
The G+C content of the DNA is 35 mol%.
